$$Y_{ij} = (\beta_0  + \mu_{0j}) + (\beta_1 + \mu_{1j})\bf{time_{ij}} + \beta_2 SNP_j + \epsilon_{ij}$$ 
$$\epsilon_{ij} \sim N(0, \sigma_{\epsilon ij}^2)$$ 
$$\sigma_{\epsilon ij} = exp (\alpha + \gamma + \tau \bf{SNP})$$ 
$$\begin{bmatrix} \mu_{0j} \\ \mu_{1j} \\ \gamma_j \end{bmatrix} \sim N(0, \Omega_{\mu \gamma})$$ $$\Omega_{\mu \gamma} = \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_{\mu0}^2 & & \\ \sigma_{\mu01} & \sigma_{\mu1}^2 & \\ \sigma_{\mu0 \gamma} & \sigma_{\mu1 \gamma} & \sigma_{\gamma}^2 \end{bmatrix}$$

NOTE: I removed the \^2 in $\sigma_{\epsilon ij}$ since the function stats::rnorm takes the standard deviation not variance in the data generating process. Similarly, nlme::lme returns the SD and not the variance in modmer objects.
